questions.question: What is the main function of an evaporator in a chemical process?

answers.b: Separating solid impurities from a liquid
answers.c: Concentrating a solution by removing solvent as vapor

explanations.a: Mixing is not the purpose of an evaporator.
explanations.b: This is the function of a filter or centrifuge.
explanations.c: Correct! Evaporators remove solvent (usually water) to concentrate the solution. Learn more
explanations.d: Cooling is the role of a heat exchanger or cooler.

questions.question: Which of the following components is typically used to supply heat in an evaporator?

explanations.a: Cold water cannot supply heat for evaporation.
explanations.b: Correct! Saturated steam is commonly used as the heating medium. Read more
explanations.c: Compressed air is used in pneumatic systems, not heating.
explanations.d: Refrigerants are used for cooling, not heating.

questions.question: Why is vacuum often applied in evaporators used for heat-sensitive materials?

answers.a: To increase pressure and speed up boiling
answers.b: To raise the temperature of the feed
answers.c: To lower the boiling point and avoid thermal degradation
answers.d: To condense the vapor more quickly

explanations.a: Vacuum decreases pressure, not increases it.
explanations.b: Vacuum is not used to raise temperature.
explanations.c: Correct! Lowering boiling point protects heat-sensitive materials. Details here
explanations.d: Condensation depends more on cooling surfaces.

questions.question: In which industry is the use of multi-effect evaporators most common?

explanations.a: Textile uses evaporators, but not multi-effect ones typically.
explanations.b: Correct! MEE is widely used in milk, juice, and sugar concentration. More info
explanations.d: Power generation uses boilers and turbines, not MEE.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a benefit of using a multi-effect evaporator?

explanations.b: Energy efficiency improves with more effects.
explanations.c: Correct! Proper operation does not increase impurities. Learn why
explanations.d: Using less steam results in lower energy costs.
